intro: Landersia pervaga, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant is evergreen, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It produces small, colorful flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, often with a contrasting central stripe. Landersia pervaga is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
